parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the finding topic.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record. Used primarily as a data-cleaning field or to dynamically drive EDC form functionality, this provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. For example, used in the DD domain to indicate no information on any death details are being provided, or used in the IE domain to indicate whether the subject met all the eligibility requirements for this study at the time the subject was enrolled. \n --PERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, observations were done.
cdashModelFields.label: Any [Finding]
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --YN
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] ([study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were/Is] (there) [a/any] [Findings topic(s)] (reported/available) ([study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test, or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
cdashModelFields.label: [Observation] Performed
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --STAT. If the CDASH variable --PERF="N", the value of the STDM variable --STAT is "NOT DONE". If --PERF= "Y", --STAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., --CAT and --SCAT, --TPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable --TESTCD would be populated with --ALL and an appropriate test name (--TEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.name: --PERF
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Were (any)/Was (the)] [--TEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/question(s)/assessment(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s)]) [performed/collected]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

self.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

cdashModelFields.definition: Short character value code for the test being performed.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: May be used as a column heading when converting from a vertical dataset format to a horizontal dataset format. --TESTCD is most useful as a variable name or variable naming fragment (e.g., [--TESTCD_--ORRES]) for the clinical database or EDC system for the field in which the result is collected for that test. The short value can be up to 8 characters. When individual codelist names are used for each domain, the CDASH model does not include any Codelist name.
cdashModelFields.label: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable --TESTCD may be determined from the value collected in --TEST. The SDTMIG variables --TESTCD and --TEST are required in SDTM.
cdashModelFields.name: --TESTCD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

self.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

cdashModelFields.definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed. Examples: Platelet, Systolic Blood Pressure, Summary (Min) RR Duration, Eye Examination.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The test name will usually be pre-printed on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then the column can be headed Test or Test Name. --TEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected. When individual codelist names are used for each domain, the CDASH model does not include any Codelist name.
cdashModelFields.label: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable --TESTCD may be determined from the value collected in --TEST. The SDTMIG variables --TESTCD and --TEST are required in SDTM.
cdashModelFields.name: --TEST
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A further description of --TESTCD and --TEST.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: It is recommended that the test detail name be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then the column can be headed Test or Test Name. When individual codelist names are used for each domain, the CDASH model does not include any Codelist name.
cdashModelFields.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TSTDTL
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment] detail name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is a --CAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then Category (for example) could be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table or in the SDTMIG. Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (IECAT) is used for the IE domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Category
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment/specimen/sample])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sub-division of the --CAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is a --CAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then Subcategory (for example) could be included in the column header. --SCAT can only be used if there is a --CAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Subcategory
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SCAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment/specimen/sample])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

cdashModelFields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding, as originally received or collected.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: In most cases, the Question Text and Item Prompt for --ORRES are specific to the --TEST. The value of --TEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected. If the form is laid out as a grid, then Result (for example) could be included in the column header. On CRFs used for drug accountability, the prompt and question text can reflect that the "amount" of study drug dispensed/returned is collected rather than a result.
cdashModelFields.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ORRES
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit of the result, as originally received or collected.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The Question Text and Item Prompt for --ORRESU may be specific to the --TEST. Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology is used for the SDTMIG PP and VS domains (i.e., PKUNIT, VSRESU).
cdashModelFields.label: Original Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ORRESU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit of the result if it were collected as a non-standard unit.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The collected non-standard unit(s) should be reported as an equivalent standard unit in --ORRESU.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Non-Standard Unit
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The collected non-standard unit(s) may be submitted in a SUPP--dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL when SUPP--.QNAM = --CRESU and SUPP.QLABEL= "Collected Non-Standard Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CRESU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

cdashModelFields.definition: Text description of any findings.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --RES and --DESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See CDASHIG Section 8.3.1, General Finding Assumptions.
cdashModelFields.label: Description of Finding
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, if the CDASH field -- RES = "NORMAL/ABSENT", populate the SDTM variables --ORRES and --STRESC with the value of the CDASH field --RES. If the value of the CDASH field --RES is "ABNORMAL/PRESENT", populate the SDTM variable --ORRES with the CDASH field --DESC. If the reported findings in --DESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable --STRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and --MODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in --DESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable --STRESC is populated with the CDASH --DESC field. The SDTM variable --NRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate.
cdashModelFields.name: --DESC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (description) of the [(abnormality/observed finding/Sponsor-defined)]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

cdashModelFields.definition: The result of the measurement or finding, as originally received or collected.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --RES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable --ORRES. --RES is typically used in conjunction with --DESC, or --RESOTH.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Result or Finding
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. See CDASH variables --DESC or --RESOTH for mapping information.
cdashModelFields.name: --RES
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment ] )?; [Is/Was] the result [normal/abnormal/absent/present/ sponsored defined response]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

cdashModelFields.definition: A free-text result providing further information about the original received or collected result.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --RES and ---RESOTH are used when a question is asked that allows the selection of a pre-specified finding, with a follow-up question to ask about the pre-specified response "OTHER". See CDASHIG Section 8.3.1, General Finding Assumptions.
cdashModelFields.label: Result Other
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field --RES is mapped to the SDTM variable --STRESC and the value in the CDASH field --RESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable --ORRES.
cdashModelFields.name: --RESOTH
cdashModelFields.questionText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A categorization of the result of a finding.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. Example: MALIGNANT or BENIGN for tumor findings. RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation. Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (MSRESCAT) is used for the MS domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Result Category
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --RESCAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the result category (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

rootItem.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

self.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

cdashModelFields.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in --ORRES.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
cdashModelFields.label: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ORNRLO
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in --ORRES.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --ORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
cdashModelFields.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ORNRHI
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The normal reference ranges that are expressed as characters ("Negative to Trace") or ordinal (-1 to 1).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Should be populated for normal ranges that are reported as character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Character/Ordinal Normal Range
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, maps to --STNRC.
cdashModelFields.name: --CSTNRC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the normal reference range (for this [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication or description of how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by --ORNRLO, --ORNRHI, --STNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL; ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
cdashModelFields.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --NRIND
cdashModelFields.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site record the value as "Not Done".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH --PERF field. Typically a check box which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is intentionally left blank.
cdashModelFields.label: Completion Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free-text or sponsor-defined listing for --REASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
cdashModelFields.name: --STAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?; Indicate if (the [--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Not Done
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASND
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) providing the test results.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site
cdashModelFields.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --NAM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the name of the [vendor] used?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable (e.g., a lab test).
cdashModelFields.label: LOINC Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LOINC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the LOINC code?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
cdashModelFields.label: Specimen Material Type
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SPEC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the specimen (material) type?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen, or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol (e.g, a section or part of what is described in the --SPEC variable).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The SDTM variable --ANTREG is defined as a variable qualifier of the SDTM variable --SPEC.
cdashModelFields.label: Anatomical Region
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ANTREG
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical or biological region (of the [organ specimen/tissue])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The condition of the specimen.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Standardized text describing the condition of the sample (e.g., HEMOLYZED, LIPEMIC)
cdashModelFields.label: Specimen Condition
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SPCCND
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication about the usability of the specimen for obtaining the test result.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Specimen Usability Flag
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, if the CDASH variable --CSPUFL="Y", the value of the STDM variable --CSPUFL is "Y". If CSPULF="N", --CSPULF is null.
cdashModelFields.name: --CSPUFL
cdashModelFields.questionText: What is/was the usability (of this specimen)?; [Is/Was] the specimen usable?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (VSPOS) is used in the VS domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Position of Subject During Observation
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --POS
cdashModelFields.questionText: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment/specimen collection/sample collection])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be pre-printed or collected. --LOC is used only to specify the anatomical location. --LAT, --DIR, --PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
cdashModelFields.label: Location Used for the Measurement
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LOC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?; What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen/question/assessment] was [taken/collected]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location of the --TEST. This may be pre-printed or collected.
cdashModelFields.label: Laterality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the directionality of the location of the --TEST (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Directionality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DIR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A detailed description of the location of the identified finding.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Use if --LOC and --LAT and/or --DIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified findings. --LOCDTL is not meant to replace --LOC, --LAT, and/or --DIR, or to serve as the free-text description field for --LOC (e.g., Location, Other).
cdashModelFields.label: Location Detail
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM="--LOCDTL" and SUPP--.QLABEL="Location Detail".
cdashModelFields.name: --LOCDTL
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the [finding] so that it can be distinguished from other [findings] in the same anatomical location?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location of the --TEST. This may be pre-printed or collected.
cdashModelFields.label: Portion or Totality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PORTOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The method of the test or examination.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (EGMETHOD) is used in the EG domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Method of Test or Examination
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --METHOD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?; What was the method (used to [measure/test/examine/question/assess/evaluate/identify] the [finding])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (EGLEAD) is used in the EG domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Lead Identified to Collect Measurements
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LEAD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement.
cdashModelFields.label: Consciousness State
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CSTATE
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the consciousness state of the subject (at the time of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication as to whether the subject had abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
cdashModelFields.label: Fasting Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --FAST
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Evaluator
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --EVAL
cdashModelFields.questionText: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role, recorded in --EVAL.
cdashModelFields.label: Evaluator Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --EVALID
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase- information)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.
cdashModelFields.label: Accepted Record Flag
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ACPTFL
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] this record considered to be the [accepted/final] evaluation?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may choose not to collect --TOX. If collected, sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.
cdashModelFields.label: Toxicity
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TOX
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the description of the [NCI CTCAE/scale name] toxicity?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may choose not to collect --TOXGR. If collected, sponsors should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define- XML document. Note: CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3 or TOXGRV4) may be used for this variable.
cdashModelFields.label: Toxicity Grade
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TOXGR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [NCI CTCAE Toxicity/scale name] grade?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The severity or intensity of a particular finding.
cdashModelFields.label: Severity
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SEV
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the severity (of the finding)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of the relationship of a particular finding to the death of a subject.
cdashModelFields.label: Relationship to Death
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DTHREL
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] this findings related to the death of the subject?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected lower limit of quantitation for an assay, represented in text format or as a range, such as less than a specified numeric value.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: These data may be obtained directly from the lab or the electronic equipment and not collected on the CRF. The units are those used for the SDTM variable --STRESU. This is not the lower limit of normal of the reference range for the test. The SDTM variable --LLOQ must be populated as a numeric.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Lower Limit of Quantitation
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable, --CLLOQ maps to the SDTM variable --LLOQ. The units will be those used for --STRESU.
cdashModelFields.name: --CLLOQ
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the lower limit of quantification (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected upper limit of quantitation for an assay, represented in text format or as a range, such as greater than a specified numeric value.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: These data may be obtained directly from the lab or the electronic equipment and not collected on the CRF. The units are those used for the SDTM variable --STRESU. This is not the upper limit of normal of the reference range for the test. The SDTM variable --ULOQ must be populated as a numeric.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Upper Limit of Quantitation
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable, --CULOQ maps to the SDTM variable --ULOQ. The units will be those used for --STRESU.
cdashModelFields.name: --CULOQ
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the upper limit of quantification (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).
cdashModelFields.label: Test Condition Met
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP--dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL when SUPP--.QNAM = --COND and SUPP.QLABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --COND
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Are/Were] the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.
cdashModelFields.label: Clinical Significance
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP--dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL when SUPP--.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPP--.QLABEL="Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CLSIG
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination/question/assessment]) result clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point or within a visit).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
cdashModelFields.label: Repetition Number
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--REPNUM" and SUPP--.QLABEL="Repetition Number within Time Point". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --REPNUM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the repetition number within (the) [time point/visit/timeframe] (for this [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Same as Previous Sample Collection Date

rootItem.title: Same as Previous Sample Collection Date

self.title: Same as Previous Sample Collection Date

cdashModelFields.definition: A flag indicating that the date (or start date) is the same as the previous specimen collection date (or start date).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When a series of specimens are recorded on a single CRF, this field is tied to the collection date to allow for the flag to be used as a surrogate for the date field. Its selection means that the date of this specimen is the same as the date of the last specimen collected (in the series). Usually a checkbox or tick box on the CRF. This would typically be used in the PC domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Same as Previous Sample Collection Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --DATFL
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] this specimen/sample collected on the same date as the (last/previous specimen/sample) (collected/collection ended)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

priorVersion.title: Same as Current Sample Collection Start Date

rootItem.title: Same as Current Sample Collection Start Date

self.title: Same as Current Sample Collection Start Date

cdashModelFields.definition: A flag indicating that the specimen/sample collection ended on the same date the current/previous specimen collection started.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When a series of interval sample/specimen collections are recorded on a single CRF, this field is tied to the start of the current collection to allow for the flag to be used as a surrogate for the date field. Its selection means that the end date of this specimen/sample collection is the same as the start date of the current specimen/sample collected. Usually a checkbox or tick box on the CRF. This would typically be used in the PC domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Same as Current Sample Collection Start Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --ENDATF
cdashModelFields.prompt: Same as Current (Specimen's/Sample Collection) Start Date
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] this specimen/sample collection ended on the same day as the current specimen's/sample's start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A free-text comment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide a comment about a particular record, use the COVAL(n) field to collect the free text, and associate the free-text comment with the original record using SDTM variables RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Comment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable --COVAL maps to the SDTM variable COVAL (COVAL2, COVAL3) in the CO domain. Associate the free-text comment in the CO domain with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF.
cdashModelFields.name: COVAL
cdashModelFields.prompt: [abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Protocol-specified Targeted Question]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: If the value for --ORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF; sponsors will populate this through the coding process. The rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Modified Term
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --MODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Body system or organ class that is involved for a finding, from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: --BODSYS should be assigned using a coding system. If included on the CRF, it is pre-populated and must be paired by the sponsor with specific pre-specified verbatim terms. If not included on the CRF, --BODSYS is assigned through the coding process.
cdashModelFields.label: Body System or Organ Class
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --BODSYS
cdashModelFields.questionText: What is/was the [body system/organ system]?

description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2021-06-25)
label: Findings
name: Findings
